title: IPL 2024: Hardik Pandya returns to Mumbai Indians, Cam Green traded to RCB – Full squad updates
content:
The Gujarat Titans traded their title winning skipper Hardik Pandya to his former team Mumbai Indians on Monday. This development comes just a day after the Titans retained the all-rounder after many speculations ahead of the Indian Premier League 2024 season.Pandya joins the five-time champions in an all-cash trade, which was fecilitated by the release of all-arounder Cameron Green from the Mumbai Indians squad.After plying his trade for the Mumbai-based franchise for a solitary season, Green is now headed to the Royal Challengers Bangalore set-up. The Australian cricketer was brought by Mumbai Indians for a record Rs 17.5 crore in the last auction.Earlier on Sunday, all the ten teams in fray retained their core group of players, whilst also releasing some big names from their squad. The list of released players include Jofra Archer from Mumbai Indians, Ben Stokes from Chennai Super Kings, Joe Root from Rajasthan Royals, Shahrukh Khan from Punjab Kings, Harshal Patel from Royal Challengers Bangalore, Harry Brook from Sunrisers Hyderabad among others.The Pandya and Green trade means that a total of seven players have been traded in the ongoing transfer window. Earlier Romario Sheperd, Avesh Khan, Devdutt Padikkal, Mayank Dagar, and Shahbaz Ahmed, had all switched teams.The transfer window will remain open until a week before the 2024 IPL player auction, which is slated to be held on December 19 in Dubai.Straight swap for Avesh Khan and Devdutt PadikkalFast bowler Avesh Khan was traded from the Lucknow Super Giants to the Rajasthan Royals, while batter Devdutt Padikkal was dealt the other way during the trading window, announced the league on Wednesday.So far, Khan has played 47 IPL matches and has picked up 55 IPL wickets. The right-arm pacer, who represented Super Giants in 22 matches & picked 26 wickets after joining the franchise in 2022, was traded to RR for his existing fee. Devdutt Padikkal, meanwhile, will also head to Lucknow from Rajasthan for his existing fee. The left-handed batter has 57 IPL matches under his belt and has scored 1521 runs including a hundred and 9 half-centuries. He joined Royals in 2022 & represented the side in as many as 28 matches, scoring 637 runs. Romario Shepherd moves to Mumbai IndiansRomario Shepherd was moved by the Super Giants to the Mumbai Indians earlier this month. This was the first move in the transfer window this season.Shahbaz Ahmed and Mayank Dagar swappedRoyal Challengers Bangalore and Sunrisers Hyderabad have swapped Shahbaz Ahmed and Mayank Dagar ahead of the new season.Ahamad, a left-arm bowler who played for RCB 10 times last season, joins Sunrisers Hyderabad for his existing fee of Rs 2.4 crore.Dagar, an all-rounder who played thrice for SRH last season, joins RCB for his existing fee of Rs 1.8 crore. Complete list of trades, retentions, released
